text: Despite Konami's current state, I still believe that one day we will have a Castlevania game set during the 1999 war with Julius, Yoko and Alucard vs Dracula's last struggle. I just hope it meets my expectations when the time comes.

text: The eternal debate: Which is better, Aria of Sorrow or Dawn of Sorrow?
author: drunyon214

text: drunyon214 well what's the difference? I've never played Aria of sorrow. I remember in Dawn of Sorrow, you could steal monsters powers and you had to do that little seal thing to be bosses. That was pretty fun.

text: Same deal, except for the seal business. Also, some powers are slightly different.
author: EvilMariobot

text: Dawn of Sorrow for the most part, although Aria had the better story and no fucking seals.
author: Alfonso ST

text:
Aria. Better secrets, better variety of weapons, better artstyle, better characters, better story.
That said, Dawn is still a great game!
author: Master Henks

text: This game was extremely underrated. I played through it so many times and loved every minute of it.
